snippet: It began with an insult directed at a Muslim shopper in North Brunswick, N.J. It ended with a store assistant manager being honored for, as he put it, “just doing my job.”
abstract: Samuel G Freedman On Religion column recounts incident in which Muslim woman Heba Macksoud was delivered religiously-motivated insult at her regular grocery store in North Brunswick, NJ; Macksoud complained to assistant manager Mark Egan who personally ensured her safety for rest of visit; Egan was later given award by Muslim-Jewish alliance Sisterhood of Salaam Shalom.
lead_paragraph: It began with an insult directed at a Muslim shopper in North Brunswick, N.J. It ended with a store assistant manager being honored for, as he put it, “just doing my job.”

headline.print_headline: A Parable on Bigotry, Citizenship and Shopping
headline.main: Parable on Bigotry and Citizenship Plays Out in a Supermarket
